ygData.subject: There's More To Him Then Meets The Eye.
ygData.msgSnippet: * Dinobot didn’t really hear Necromancer speak before they took off, his eyes closed and his brows casting shadows over them. His head remained on his front

* Dinobot didn�t really hear Necromancer speak before they took off, his 
eyes closed and his brows casting shadows over them.
His head remained on his front limbs, his tail twitching slightly behind 
him.
By converting into Beast Mode he had slowed down the deterioration of the 
fourth fluid pump, now it was just a constant and pulsating ache in his 
chest.
His stomach lurched a bit as Necromancer took off, but then settled back 
down once they were all in the air.
The fresh wind blowing past his face was rather refreshing, the breeze 
against his wounded chest soothing it to nothing more then a throb.
But there was something on his mind, something that needed dealing with�that 
smaller bot.
He would admit that he was kind and rather generous, however�he didn�t like 
being touched and that smaller bot had touched him a little more then 
comfortable.
A rather soft growl trickled out from between his closed lips, his entire 
face expressionless.
Even though his eyes were closed he heard Tavatrons sigh, wondering slightly 
just what filth she mush be thinking of him now. Probably thinking just how 
much of a hot headed prick he was (excuse the swear, please.)
But at the moment, he was actually trying to keep himself calm and his 
adrenaline down to a minimum of growls.
Any increase in spark rate would result in more fluid loose then he already 
had, and the last thing he needed to do was become stressed and loses 
whatever little mech-fluid was keeping his pump active.
But then he heard Tavatron as him if she could ask him something, even 
though he thought that it was rather a stupid question he answered. *

� What?!�

* His voice was rather flat but it had a slight annoyed tone to it, his tail 
slightly swinging a little more then usual.
But then his optics snapped open when he heard her question, his mind sudden 
reeling for an answer to it.
It was rather a shock to be asked such a thing, wondering just what it was 
she expected to hear from his lips.
Dinobot lifted his head from his forelimbs and looked at Tavatron plainly, 
still wondering just what he could say to answer her question.
He really had to think about what she said, wondering if he really KNEW the 
answer to it.
He laid his head back down on his arms, still looking at her back.
Still trying to think of a reasonable answer to speak.
He had to admit, above the clouds and the moon in plain view, she looked 
rather good�for a femm.
Though the thought that he actually cared for her was more apparent in his 
mind, he wasn�t quite sure that he should say so as his answer.
It was rather a touchy subject, but to say anything else would be a sure 
fire lie.*

� It makes a difference to me. Does that not count for something?�

* His voice was rather quiet and it�s usual harsh self, but all anger had 
receded from his voice now.
And for once in his life, it actually sounded as if there was a slight bit 
of emotion within the depths of his voice, if once was skilled enough to 
stop and hear it.
Strangely enough, Dinobot didn�t feel uncomfortable, even though Tavatron 
had put him in the spotlight with her question.
But, he knew how she felt, only that he had never had a bot whom ever cared 
about him and if he ever came back alive.
Except for the Maximals of old, he had been alone. However, he had not died 
alone.
Dinobot�s tail twitched thoughtfully as he continued to look at Tavatron�s 
back.*

� And you make more of a difference then you know.�

* And she did.
She was a soldier of the Maximal force and as one she made an extreme 
difference on the battlefield, as well as on the lives she touched.
Such as his.
He had never really known real friendship until he had met her, a woman whom 
challenge his very abilities and made him strove to become better then he 
already was.
Tavatron made more of a difference then she could possibly know, on his life 
alone.
She made him stop and think things over, while in past days he would simply 
charge into things blindly. She also made him worry, which he had never done 
before, and thus think about the outcomes of things before they even 
happened.
Tavatron, even though he wasn�t about to admit it, had cracked his solid 
walls of stone and ice and had actually found what little remained of his 
spark�and made him care.
She was and had to be a very remarkable woman in order to do that, where all 
else had failed.
Dinobot cleared his throat and shifted his eyes up, into the skys.
But even as he did so he was rather surprised at what he saw, millions upon 
millions of stars. And he was surprised that he could see every one as well.
Back on the ground it was impossible to see this, above the clouds it was 
breathtaking.
He was actually amazed!
Dinobot lifted his head from his hands and craned his neck, tilting his head 
all the way back until he was looking straight up. Occasionally shifting it 
from side to side only to discover the patterns among the stars in which the 
later humans called the Zodiac.
But he remembered, remembered just what it was like to be in those stars, to 
be ONE of those stars.
Back when he was searching for the Matrix he had to travel through them, 
among them. But he had never reached his destination, for a reason he didn�t 
yet know.
The only thing he figured was that he wasn�t ready to die, to give up the 
battles and wars so easily.
Perhaps resurrected to finally finished what he helped to create, the Beast 
Wars.
But as he gazed at the stars overhead, he also wondered just what would 
become of him once the Beast Wars were over. Once there were no battles to 
be fought.
Well, it was still a long way to go yet.
But he�d find out someday.*
